alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 3:04AM EST until January 28 at 9:12PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central North Carolina, including Forsyth county. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 AM EST, Widespread moderate to heavy rainfall across the region has resulted in high water in area creeks, streams, ditches, and drainage areas. Doppler radar estimates that 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rain has fallen in the last 6 hours. While additional rainfall should be under a quarter inch through this morning, the runoff from the earlier rain is causing minor flooding in some locations, including along the Muddy Creek near Clemmons. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, King, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Pfafftown, Stanleyville, Sedge Garden, Donnaha, Belews Creek and Belews Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
